clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Polyphenol-rich Cocoa Extract on Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells Gene Expression
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of the Administration of a Polyphenol-rich Cocoa Extract on Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells Gene Expression in Humans

lead_sponsor.agency: Technological Centre of Nutrition and Health, Spain

clinical_study.source: Technological Centre of Nutrition and Health, Spain

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

brief_summary.textblock: It has been evidenced that chocolate and cocoa consumption increase vasodilation and reduce blood pressure. However, the mechanisms implicated in these effects have not been elucidated yet. The purpose of this study is to evaluate changes in gene expression induced by the administration of a polyphenol-rich cocoa extract in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) in humans.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective, randomized, controlled, double-blind and cross-over study. The intervention will consist in the administration of 250g of chocolate cream with or without the extract after 12 hours fasting. Blood samples will be taken at point 0, 2, 3 and 6 hours after the administration. At each time point, blood pressure and endothelial function (with a non-invasive method) will be measured.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Gene expression changes in PBMCs (using a microarray)

secondary_outcome.measure: Endothelial function (assessed by ischemic reactive hyperemia)

arm_group.description: 250 g of chocolate cream supplemented with 2.3 g of polyphenol-rich cocoa extract (containing 1050 mg of total polyphenols)

intervention.description: 250 g of chocolate cream supplemented with 2.3 g of polyphenol-rich cocoa extract (containing 1050 mg of total polyphenols)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1.Healthy males between the ages of 20 and 39 who do not meet any of the exclusion criteria.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Body mass index (BMI) lower than 18 or greater than 27 Kg/m2
2. Smokers
3. Regular medication
4. Consumption of medication during the last week
5. Following a weight-loss diet
6. Vegetarians
7. Abnormal glucose levels
8. Diabetes
9. Cardiovascular disease
10. Gastrointestinal disease
11. Anemia
12. Allergy
